alert.note: Alert for Northern High Plains; Southern High Plains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 23 at 5:55PM MST until December 24 at 6:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MST SATURDAY... ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM SATURDAY TO NOON MST SUNDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, patchy blowing snow, with wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Blizzard Warning, ground blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 70 mph. * WHERE...The foothills and plains adjacent to the Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 AM MST Saturday. For the Blizzard Warning, from 6 AM Saturday to Noon MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...In addition, some rain may fall Saturday evening. While air temperatures may be above freezing, rain may still freeze on contact with the frozen ground.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Northern High Plains; Southern High Plains
